text: *Random Question* - Anyone know if it would be possible to connect Zapier to HubDB?

you could using their webhooks tool, but I think it would only work as an "action;" as far as I know there are no triggers to run an action based on HubDB activity, either from Zapier directly or from HubSpot's end.

I also believe you would need to use a HAPI key for authentication, but I haven't used Zapier in a while, so they may have a way of using OAuth for this use-case that I'm not aware of
<@U22PKFRU5> I've used Zapier to add data into HubDB using webhooks, drop me a message and I'll send you some screenshots
Heads Up - we're pushing a change to HubDB that moves the "add column" button under the Actions dropdown, in case anyone was wondering where it got off to :slightly_smiling_face:
Can anybody tell me what's wrong with the above HubDB filter?
Trying to filter on greater than but it keeps coming out in the query string as equals
Figured it out... column wasn't set as a number
Happened to the best of us.

Honestly... I'm just exploring a random thought I had last night at 3AM... "Why aren't folks connecting HubDB into the vast world of Zapier integrations?"

I wasn't sure if there was something technical limiting it (I'm not a developer, so IDK :upside_down_face:).

Cool to hear it miiiiight be possible... Hopefully we'll see more people pushing the limits and opening up the CMS using it. :slightly_smiling_face:
Got a few DM's from folks who have set it up
You are likely going to have to build some sort of outside integration that reads your analytics and then feeds the data into the hubdb api

Currently I believe Nick is correct. Dynamic page view count is not accessible via HubL otherwise.

Diego, I would encourage you to post this on our idea forum. That will help others voice their interest in having this ability. Posting a use case scenario will also help. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/idb-p/HubSpot_Ideas>
